title: How to Play Pac Man in Real Life

steps.headline: The whole point of the game is that there is one or more ghost and the rest of the people are Pac Man.
steps.description: That means, one or more person is catching the rest of the people who are running on lines.

steps.headline: Choose a spot to play.
steps.description: Find a huge area of land that is used for recreational purposes. It would be better if it has lines or circles all over it e.g. a basketball court. Make sure there isn't anyone there and it is a surface where you can draw things on it with chalks or a rock. The bigger the space, the better. When using a public place, always ask for permission first!

steps.headline: Find people who are willing to play.
steps.description: It’s a straightforward game that anyone can understand. You can ask your family members or friends. Remember that the more people you invite, the larger area you have to hire.

steps.headline: Once you have assembled everything, you’re ready to set up the playing field.
steps.description: You will need a rock or a chalk to do this.

steps.headline: Grab the rock or chalk and draw a shape that fits the whole area (unless if it’s really big).
steps.description: It should be around the size of a normal basketball court depending on how many people are playing (i.e. 30 people = 2 or 3 basketball courts).

steps.headline: Next, draw random lines that connect to the biggest shape you drew.
steps.description: The lines can be anywhere as long as a person can walk around. Always remember to leave some space around it. Add in some strange shapes too. This can be circles, hexagons, cylinders etc. Add in some tricky bits too to make the game more fun. Ensure all of the lines you drew are touching other lines so there won’t be a dead-end. You can though if you want to but don’t add in too many.

steps.headline: Draw a circle in the middle of the playing field.
steps.description: That will be the place where the ghost will start. You don’t have to draw it as the ghost can start anywhere but it’s best too so you don’t have to choose the position where the ghost stays.

steps.headline: Pick the person that is going to be the ghost.
steps.description: Pick one if you have a very less amount of players i.e. 10 players= 1 ghost. If you have more, it’s better to choose two. Remember you can always restart and play the game over and over again.

steps.headline: Ask the ghosts to stay in the middle of the circle or choose any place.
steps.description: This will mean that the rest of the players are Pac Man who have to run away from the ghosts.

steps.headline: Ask the Pac Men to stand in any place they like as long as it’s on a line.
steps.description: They will obviously stay away from the ghost.

steps.headline: When you start the game, everyone can run but the ghosts will chase the Pac Men which is the whole point of the game.
steps.description: All of the player ‘’’must’’’ stay on the line when running. No cutting corners! Whoever fails to follow the rules, they immediately are out which will be explained in the next step.

steps.headline: When a ghost successfully touches a Pac Man, the Pac Man sits down (to avoid confusion with players) on the place where they got touched which means they are ‘out’.
steps.description: Their job is to block the rest of the Pac Man from getting to the other side of the line. That means: e.g. there is a person out and is sitting on a line, a Pac Man sees the person out but can’t go on the other side of the line. If they do however, that is cheating which means that they are out. Also, there is only one person in a row of a line. That means, there can’t be two people standing next to each other running on a line. If that happens, they’re out.

steps.headline: The ghost though has special privileges which let them pass the ‘out’ Pac Man no matter how many there are in a line.
steps.description: This makes the game more fun and quick. This rules ‘’’only’’’ applies to the ghost.

steps.headline: When there is only one more Pac Man left, that person is acclaimed as the winner.
This method is fantastic if you have only 2 players.
steps.description: The whole point of this game is to see who get the most candies.

steps.headline: Pick a place a again - somewhere big.
steps.description: On that place, draw a maze. Something like the layout of the original ‘Pac Man’ game. Don’t forget to pick a starting point for all of the players.

steps.headline: Place the wrapped-up candies all over the maze but not onto the out-of-bounds areas.
Let the players hold a bag.
steps.description: When you say start, the players have to roam through their way collecting the wrapped-up candies on the floor. They can’t pass the out-of-bounds areas. If they do, then they’re disqualified from the game.

steps.headline: When all the candies are picked up, count who has the most.
steps.description: The person with the most lollies, gets all of the lollies and is declared as the ‘winner’.

tyn: A huge area preferably with lines
Chalks or rocks (if the place you are in doesn't have lines)
First-Aid to prevent any injuries if any
Hard- Boiled Candies in a wrapper or any wrapped-up candy to avoid germs going onto the lolly
text: Game One: Run Away! The whole point of the game is that there is one or more ghost and the rest of the people are Pac Man. That means, one or more person is catching the rest of the people who are running on lines. Choose a spot to play. Find a huge area of land that is used for recreational purposes. It would be better if it has lines or circles all over it e.g. a basketball court. Make sure there isn't anyone there and it is a surface where you can draw things on it with chalks or a rock. The bigger the space, the better. When using a public place, always ask for permission first! Find people who are willing to play. It’s a straightforward game that anyone can understand. You can ask your family members or friends. Remember that the more people you invite, the larger area you have to hire. Once you have assembled everything, you’re ready to set up the playing field. You will need a rock or a chalk to do this. Grab the rock or chalk and draw a shape that fits the whole area (unless if it’s really big). It should be around the size of a normal basketball court depending on how many people are playing (i.e. 30 people = 2 or 3 basketball courts). Next, draw random lines that connect to the biggest shape you drew. The lines can be anywhere as long as a person can walk around. Always remember to leave some space around it. Add in some strange shapes too. This can be circles, hexagons, cylinders etc. Add in some tricky bits too to make the game more fun. Ensure all of the lines you drew are touching other lines so there won’t be a dead-end. You can though if you want to but don’t add in too many. Draw a circle in the middle of the playing field. That will be the place where the ghost will start. You don’t have to draw it as the ghost can start anywhere but it’s best too so you don’t have to choose the position where the ghost stays. Pick the person that is going to be the ghost. Pick one if you have a very less amount of players i.e. 10 players= 1 ghost. If you have more, it’s better to choose two. Remember you can always restart and play the game over and over again. Ask the ghosts to stay in the middle of the circle or choose any place. This will mean that the rest of the players are Pac Man who have to run away from the ghosts. Ask the Pac Men to stand in any place they like as long as it’s on a line. They will obviously stay away from the ghost. When you start the game, everyone can run but the ghosts will chase the Pac Men which is the whole point of the game. All of the player ‘’’must’’’ stay on the line when running. No cutting corners! Whoever fails to follow the rules, they immediately are out which will be explained in the next step. When a ghost successfully touches a Pac Man, the Pac Man sits down (to avoid confusion with players) on the place where they got touched which means they are ‘out’. Their job is to block the rest of the Pac Man from getting to the other side of the line. That means: e.g. there is a person out and is sitting on a line, a Pac Man sees the person out but can’t go on the other side of the line. If they do however, that is cheating which means that they are out. Also, there is only one person in a row of a line. That means, there can’t be two people standing next to each other running on a line. If that happens, they’re out. The ghost though has special privileges which let them pass the ‘out’ Pac Man no matter how many there are in a line. This makes the game more fun and quick. This rules ‘’’only’’’ applies to the ghost. When there is only one more Pac Man left, that person is acclaimed as the winner. Play again if desired. Game Two: No Enemies This method is fantastic if you have only 2 players. The whole point of this game is to see who get the most candies. Pick a place a again - somewhere big. On that place, draw a maze. Something like the layout of the original ‘Pac Man’ game. Don’t forget to pick a starting point for all of the players. Place the wrapped-up candies all over the maze but not onto the out-of-bounds areas.  Let the players hold a bag. When you say start, the players have to roam through their way collecting the wrapped-up candies on the floor. They can’t pass the out-of-bounds areas. If they do, then they’re disqualified from the game. When all the candies are picked up, count who has the most. The person with the most lollies, gets all of the lollies and is declared as the ‘winner’.
sentences: Game One: Run Away!
The whole point of the game is that there is one or more ghost and the rest of the people are Pac Man.
That means, one or more person is catching the rest of the people who are running on lines.
Choose a spot to play.
Find a huge area of land that is used for recreational purposes.
It would be better if it has lines or circles all over it e.g.
a basketball court.
Make sure there isn't anyone there and it is a surface where you can draw things on it with chalks or a rock.
The bigger the space, the better.
When using a public place, always ask for permission first!
Find people who are willing to play.
It’s a straightforward game that anyone can understand.
You can ask your family members or friends.
Remember that the more people you invite, the larger area you have to hire.
Once you have assembled everything, you’re ready to set up the playing field.
You will need a rock or a chalk to do this.
Grab the rock or chalk and draw a shape that fits the whole area (unless if it’s really big).
It should be around the size of a normal basketball court depending on how many people are playing (i.e.
30 people = 2 or 3 basketball courts).
Next, draw random lines that connect to the biggest shape you drew.
The lines can be anywhere as long as a person can walk around.
Always remember to leave some space around it.
Add in some strange shapes too.
This can be circles, hexagons, cylinders etc.
Add in some tricky bits too to make the game more fun.
Ensure all of the lines you drew are touching other lines so there won’t be a dead-end.
You can though if you want to but don’t add in too many.
Draw a circle in the middle of the playing field.
That will be the place where the ghost will start.
You don’t have to draw it as the ghost can start anywhere but it’s best too so you don’t have to choose the position where the ghost stays.
Pick the person that is going to be the ghost.
Pick one if you have a very less amount of players i.e.
10 players= 1 ghost.
If you have more, it’s better to choose two.
Remember you can always restart and play the game over and over again.
Ask the ghosts to stay in the middle of the circle or choose any place.
This will mean that the rest of the players are Pac Man who have to run away from the ghosts.
Ask the Pac Men to stand in any place they like as long as it’s on a line.
They will obviously stay away from the ghost.
When you start the game, everyone can run but the ghosts will chase the Pac Men which is the whole point of the game.
All of the player ‘’’must’’’ stay on the line when running.
No cutting corners!
Whoever fails to follow the rules, they immediately are out which will be explained in the next step.
When a ghost successfully touches a Pac Man, the Pac Man sits down (to avoid confusion with players) on the place where they got touched which means they are ‘out’.
Their job is to block the rest of the Pac Man from getting to the other side of the line.
That means: e.g.
there is a person out and is sitting on a line, a Pac Man sees the person out but can’t go on the other side of the line.
If they do however, that is cheating which means that they are out.
Also, there is only one person in a row of a line.
That means, there can’t be two people standing next to each other running on a line.
If that happens, they’re out.
The ghost though has special privileges which let them pass the ‘out’ Pac Man no matter how many there are in a line.
This makes the game more fun and quick.
This rules ‘’’only’’’ applies to the ghost.
When there is only one more Pac Man left, that person is acclaimed as the winner.
Play again if desired.
Game Two: No Enemies This method is fantastic if you have only 2 players.
The whole point of this game is to see who get the most candies.
Pick a place a again - somewhere big.
On that place, draw a maze.
Something like the layout of the original ‘Pac Man’ game.
Don’t forget to pick a starting point for all of the players.
Place the wrapped-up candies all over the maze but not onto the out-of-bounds areas.
Let the players hold a bag.
When you say start, the players have to roam through their way collecting the wrapped-up candies on the floor.
They can’t pass the out-of-bounds areas.
If they do, then they’re disqualified from the game.
When all the candies are picked up, count who has the most.
The person with the most lollies, gets all of the lollies and is declared as the ‘winner’.
